title: Prof. Dr. Felix Schönbrodt
text:
Managing Director of OSC
Faculty of Psychology



Felix.Schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de



Personal Website



Faculty Website



Department of Psychology



















Mission Statement
HELLO THERE. I am principal investigator for Psychological Methods and Assessment at the Department of Psychology. The reproducibility of research findings is a core criterion of science, which however, has been challenged by the failure of recent large-scale replication projects.

Together with the board of the German Psychological Society (DGPs) I developed the society's recommendations for data sharing in psychology.



Research Interests

Open Science
Psychology
Psychological Methods
Data Sharing

Selected Publications


2024

"Machine Learning Applications in Organizational Behavior"
Smith, J., Johnson, A., & Williams, R.

Journal of Applied Research, 42(3), 256-278




 DOI





2023

"Open Methods in Psychology"
Schönbrodt, F.

Psychological Methods, 15(2), 112-143




 DOI

title: Data Management, Simulation, & Sharing
text:
Introduction to Open Research Data


An introductory presentation on the what, why, and how of making research data open















FAIR Data Management


Take steps towards making your data FAIR: Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable















FAIR Data Sharing


Tutorial in progresss…















Maintaining Privacy with Open Data


A presentation on how to make data open to the public without revealing sensitive information















Introduction to Simulations in R


A self-paced tutorial on why you should use simulations for your studies, and how to set them up in R















TBD: Generating Synthetic Data


Tutorial in progress…

title: Advanced git
text: This is a placeholder page for an advanced tutorial on using git.

title: Reproducible Workflow
text:
Introduction to R


Learn the basics of the R programming language















Introduction to Version Control within RStudio


Explore the git version control software and its integrations with the popular RStudio interactive development environment















Collaborative coding with GitHub and RStudio


After learning the basics of git, apply your skills in an interactive tutorial















Advanced git


Learn git features like branching and gitflow, and how to take advantage of issues, pull requests, and more on GitHub















Introduction to {renv}


Make your projects reproducible by learning how to (easily) manage your R packages















Introduction to Zotero


Easily save your sources to the Zotero software, and learn how to insert these citations into your documents















Introduction to Quarto


Discover the basics of setting up Quarto projects, documents, and presentations















Code Publishing


Tie together your skills and publish your work

Simulations for Advanced Power Analyses


This tutorial provides a deeper dive into simulations in R, with emphasis on GLMs, LMEs, and SEMs
